content: be able to meet comfortably please remember that knitted fabric typically stretches after blocking if you want to err on the side of caution block your project at this stage by soaking it and letting it dry flat try it on and if you need to continue repeating row 1-16 or frog back to achieve the length that feels best for you ending the last repeat after knitting row 14 which is a rs row you ll now graft the live stitches that are on your needles together with the cast on edge to form a big loop my preferred method is to cast off the live stitches while also picking up stitches from the cast on edge at the same time as you can see demonstrated in this video tutorial as an alternative you can bind off the live stitches as normal without picking up at the same time and then sew the cast on and bind off edges together you can follow this video tutorial weave in all ends 3
